website_summaries.verdict: Simple and durable. Easy to store and use while out hunting without worrying about damaging the shell.
pros: The duck call uses an efficient design that doesn't require much air for a good level of volume
Narrow profile makes it easy to store in a pocket when not in use
cons: Quality of sound drops at greater distances

customer_reviews.title: Best uncle gift for kids that aren’t yours
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if it attracts ducks or not... I do in fact know that it annoys my sister and brother in law... see I figure kids yell and talk all day. What better gift for my niece and nephew than a duck call. Checkmate uncle ..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: The first time I went out with this I didn’t know anything about calling, but as I was on the lake in a boat leaving for the day, we saw a lone mallard and he flew over and I called him, he came right back. The picture is from that day with the call hanging from my neck. I am a beginner duck hunter and never used a call before I got this, it works.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Ducks come
customer_reviews.text: Bought for grandfather and he loved it. He has a pond in the back do his apartments and he uses it often.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C.

customer_reviews.title: *Quack *quack *quack (yes it works)
customer_reviews.text: Honestly bought it to entertain my niece and to quack at hockey games. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Serrato

customer_reviews.title: Great pet photography sound maker!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to get the attention of dogs and puppies that I photograph. It's perfect to grab their attention for the shot!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: This has been so fun! My 8 year old called ducks up to him at the pond and fed them. Too cute
customer_reviews.author: HopeThisHelps

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Bad sound quality , spend more money and get a good sounding call
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra R. Price

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to mock the Anaheim Ducks with ! LOL !!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product, works for our pets.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, bought it for pet ducks. Easy to use, kids love the reactions from our ducks.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Good for ducks but not the duck
customer_reviews.text: Works great but it did not help during the football game for duck Hodges to lead the steelers to the playoffs.
customer_reviews.author: stephen cornfield

customer_reviews.title: Not so effective.
customer_reviews.text: Eh, this didn't really work that great. It sounded as if it would, but when trying to use it to attract the ducks and geese on our backyard lake, they never once flew over to us.
customer_reviews.author: SMK

customer_reviews.title: Great Made in USA product.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use not a lot of effort. Only took about 5 minutes to get good sounds.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use call. Basic Mallard sounds. Perfect for a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: GRAY

customer_reviews.title: Primos Easy Mallard Call
customer_reviews.text: It works fairly well. I have to wait until I spot a flock of ducks and try it then to see how it matches.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy D.

customer_reviews.title: My grandson loved this
customer_reviews.text: My grandson was looking for his first duck call at Christmas and he loved this when it arrived and with a cord to add future duck calls. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: quacks like a duck
customer_reviews.text: An accessory for my Uncle Si costume. It sounds like a duck.
customer_reviews.author: The Beetz

customer_reviews.title: more of a noise maker
customer_reviews.text: probably not much of a duck call but i use it as a coaches whistle for coaching football... it's different
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey M. McCafferty

customer_reviews.title: NOT a mallard call
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT a mallard call in no way shape or form dose this thing sound like a mallard I find it closer to the sound of a goat in labor
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great practice call!
customer_reviews.text: I never used a duck call before and was looking for an inexpensive starter to learn technique. Hunting buddy was surprised with quality for the price. I would recommend this item for any beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Ewoldt

customer_reviews.title: It does a great feeling chuckle but thats about it
customer_reviews.text: It does a great feeling chuckle but thats about it. Also don't use it to much if its cold
customer_reviews.author: matthew G.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy it the thing souds like a damn cazoo
customer_reviews.author: Lawson allen

customer_reviews.title: Not so easy
customer_reviews.text: Not close to a pro but this is far from a easy caller and sounds off( not duck like). Thx
customer_reviews.author: kyle  Monte

customer_reviews.title: Meh, get a better one
customer_reviews.text: If you are starting out, then you know waterfowling can be pricey and you'll want to save money and get a call like this instead of a nicer one. Don't. You'll get this, find out its not very good and then have to buy a good one later. Save your $ on this and instead get one such as the Illinois River Valley calls.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Michealson

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Cool
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy having it when there are people that cannot call very well because it makes good noise and easy to blow. Also it is not Wooden, Black like it looks in the picture it is see-through Plastic. It does come apart.
customer_reviews.author: DuckCall1232

customer_reviews.title: Good to have for some that doesn't know how to blow a call but needs to make a quack noise
customer_reviews.text: Real easy to blow great for a buddy if he wants to in participate early season duck hunting. Not a bad quack either.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Sounds realistic
customer_reviews.text: This works pretty good, easy to use and you can make many different sounds with it. I live on a lake and wanted to call some ducks, what did I get? A bunch of geese. I would recommend this product though.
customer_reviews.author: SPARKY0210

customer_reviews.title: For the price nice to have
customer_reviews.text: Better than not having one but probably should of spent a little more for a much better one. I would suggest upgrading to a better call, because it's the second most important item
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great duck caller for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't need to actually call any ducks, but bought this for my mom to use at Bingo when "I-22" is called. Those who play Bingo will know what I mean. The price was right and it's fun as well.
customer_reviews.author: N. NickTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Primos Easy Mallard Call is exactly that, easy to use, seems to work well... but we only needed it for a costume so who knows how it actually works in the field
customer_reviews.author: Hold Fast

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my girlfriend who is just starting out calling. It just doesn't sound right when compared to our other calls. At first I thought it was the way she was using it, but when i tried it was just as off. Might be useful as a party favor/white elephant gift?!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Mallard call
customer_reviews.text: I created quite a stir at our local duck pond when I 'quacked' a call. Fun for me; confusing for my feathered friends.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Rohl

customer_reviews.title: quack
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my mom she plays bingo and when they call I 22 they all say quack quack aflack, not sure why
customer_reviews.author: michael l allen

customer_reviews.title: quacks like a duck
customer_reviews.text: quacks like a duck. blow in, not rub. plastic, not wood. came in box. was mailed to me. now in bag and in drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: NOISY
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my grandson since the name of his baseball team is the DUCKS. He drives everyone nuts with his call; I think it's funny to see himh anoy everyone.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Yuck!
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use at bingo when "22" is called. Does not sound right. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: IllinoisBelle

customer_reviews.title: but this thing surely sounds like a duck
customer_reviews.text: Never have I gone hunting, but this thing surely sounds like a duck.
customer_reviews.author: Luis C. C

customer_reviews.title: I love it but the neighbors don't!
customer_reviews.text: This thing makes cool squawking noises. Whether ducks like it is TBD. My skill with it so far (5 minutes practice) will probably scare the duckies off instead of luring them! (I shoot, but only pictures!) WARNING! Don't let your kids play with it or you'll go bananas! Oh well, if no luck schmoozing birds (they'll probably find me amusing!); it will make a killer New Years party toy!
customer_reviews.author: Pentatomidae

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: THis call is perfect. perfect for the price and the shipping. Hope to get some ducks with this next year.
customer_reviews.author: p gardepe

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like a sick duck
customer_reviews.text: If you call a duck in with this thing, your duck was deaf. I did better with decoys and no call. That being said, this was my first call and I'm still learning how to call. But even experienced callers can't make this thing sound like a duck.
customer_reviews.author: monkijohnni

customer_reviews.title: get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: This call is cheap and that is why it sounds like crap. Primose make a hell of alot better of call than this. Just spend the extra $10-15 and make the call worth you while.
customer_reviews.author: Duck hunter

customer_reviews.title: it's easy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for my ourdoorsy 4-yr-old nephew. I was uncertain he would be able to make a call but purchased it b/c it was called "easy." While I don't know if a Mallard would actually respond to it (as he blew it indoors ALL DAY on Christmas), I can truly say it is an EASY call.
customer_reviews.author: Karen U. Hansberger

customer_reviews.title: easy call
customer_reviews.text: has worked good for me was easy to learn and have used it for several seasons now. a good purchase for a begginner
customer_reviews.author: bowfisher

customer_reviews.title: didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't too impressed. the mallards in my back yard don't even flinch when I use this. many family members have tried it
customer_reviews.author: yasmeen razi

customer_reviews.title: Cheap in all aspects
customer_reviews.text: Has pour tone and pitch. This is the call you buy for a 3 year old to play with
customer_reviews.author: Eric Roberts

customer_reviews.title: a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: the call worked for an hour or 2 and then didnt sound anything like a duck. im just used to a double reed call
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: This duck call doesn't sound like a mallard duck. It's to high pitched and it locks up way to easy
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: NOT WHAT I EXPECTED
customer_reviews.text: THIS WAS AN ABSOLUTE BUST OF A BUY, I REALLY LIKE PRIMO, HOWEVER THIS ONE SOUNDS LIKE A DYING MOOSE. NOT IMPRESSED AND NOT EVER GOING TO BY FROM THIS SELLER AGAIN. SO DISSAPOINTED! DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY...
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: This calls a quack
customer_reviews.text: Not that great of a call, bought it for my son who likes to duck hunt, I myself am not too big on hunting.....rather be fishing! With that being said the call does not sound right compared to other duck calls and he has had no luck with it after several hunting g trips....I guess you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Nathan N

customer_reviews.title: great for the money
customer_reviews.text: the call is great for the money. i bought it because i wanted to start duck hunting. if you are looking for a cheap duck call that works good this is the call for you.
customer_reviews.author: s brazee

product_meta.title: Primos Hunting 805 Duck Call, Easy Mallard Single Reed
product_meta.description: The name says it all for the Primos easy Mallard. This call barely requires any air to blow, yet it produces great Duck sounds. If you are looking for a duck call that is easy to blow, but very "ducky", then this is the call for you! Features: - requires little air pressure to blow - single-reed call - blows when wet - .010" Thin Mylar Reed makes it super easy to blow.
feature_bullets: Requires little air pressure to blow
.010-Inch thin Mylar reed makes it super easy to blow
